Name: Onuris
Description: This bronze figurine comes from the excavations of F. Griffith at Kawa in 1933. It represents the god Onuris brandishing a lance, which has disappeared. The god of This, of which the name signifies "The one who brings back Distant One", is represented with four straight feathers on his head. He is considered as a god of war annihilating particularly the enemies of the sun. The piece, which is equipped with a ring for suspension attached to the head dress, dates from the 25th Dynasty.
